title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
The U.S. government said it will launch a broad review of the Federal Home Loan Banks, a network of government-chartered cooperatives that provide cheap funding to thousands of banks.

Bed Bath & Beyond said it would close roughly 20% of its namesake stores, cut its workforce and bring in fresh cash to stabilize the business through the holiday season.

Eurozone inflation rose to a record in August, with consumer prices 9.1% higher than a year earlier, increasing pressure on the ECB to respond aggressively.

Walt Disney is exploring a membership program that could offer discounts or special perks, according to people familiar with the discussions.

Snap announced plans to slash a fifth of its workforce as part of a strategic reorientation that underlines how sharply the company's fortunes have turned.

Netflix is looking to charge brands premium prices to advertise on its coming ad-supported platform, according to some ad buyers.

What's News: Business & Finance
